    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int width,
     int height)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The constructor of the Board class.
        Parameters:
        width - : Board width
        height - : Board height
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException, - if width < 1 or height <1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Requires:
        There are classes Cell and Nothing exist and can be accessed by the Board class. Cell has a constructor that takes a single ChewyObject argument.
        Ensures:
        Cells matrix is initialized. Each cell in the cells is filled by a Nothing object. Width and height fields are set. IllegalArgumentException is thrown with message "Board width and height should be positive" if width<1 or height<1.

    • Method Detail

      • repOk

        public boolean repOk()
        A testing method returns false if width or height is illegally set to a value smaller than 1 ,cells field is null, any cell object is null or any cell object was filled by null.
        Returns true, otherwise.

      • inBoard

        public boolean inBoard(int x,
              int y)
        Requires:
        width and height is initialized successfully.
        Ensures:
        Returns true if x is in range [0...width] and y is in range [0...height], false o/w.

      • cellAt

        public Cell cellAt(int x,
          int y)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException: - for too big or negative indexes
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Requires:
        inBoard method is implemented correctly with two int arguments represents x and y, respectively.
        • Fields cells matrix and each element of this matrix are non-null. Cell class has an instance method with no arguments named clone for copying itself.
        Ensures:
        A clone of the cell at (x, y) is returned if coordinates are in the board, An Illegal argument exception should be thrown for illegal x and y indexes.

      • fillCellAt

        public void fillCellAt(int x,
              int y,
              ChewyObject co)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Fills the cell at (x, y) with ChewyObject co.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Requires:
        repOk.
        Modifies:
        cells
        Ensures:
        Cell of the board at (x,y) is filled if x and y are in the board, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown o/w.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Requires:
        width is initializes
        Ensures:
        width value is returned,

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Requires:
        height is initializes
        Ensures:
        height value is returned,

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        All cells are returned as a formatted String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • status

        public java.lang.String status()
        Returns sizes of the Board and cells data for comparison and testing purposes.
